column4: Is there a deb of the latest rTorrent 0.7.9 I believe? The rTorrent in the repository is too old, and it does not support DHT and peer exchange. I'm having tracker timeouts issues.
hardy has 0.7.8 is that high enough?
I'll take 0.7.8 if it's not the one on the ubuntu forums which has a dependency issue.

If you want to try .7.8 you should read up on how to backport a package, it's pretty easy, involves adding the deb-src lines to your /etc/apt/sources.lst then running "apt-get build-dep <package> && apt-get source --compile <package>"
how did you install the hacked up version, from a deb, or from a source tar.gz?

deb. That's why I have both listed under Versions in the package properties in Synaptic. I can switch between them. For example, I have libgtk2.0-0 version 2.12.0-1ubuntu3.1 (now) and 2.12.0-1ubuntu3 (gutsy). I want to uninstall the (now).
I want to do something like dpkg --purge --version 2.12.0-1ubuntu3.1 libgtk2.0-0
if it's done via that synaptic interface it probably means both can't be installed at once, so does forcing the gutsy version solve the issue?
Yeah, I'm running the gutsy version. My question is how do I remove the hacked up version from the database.
how did you install it in the first place?
deb, but they are not listed as 2 separate debs. they are listed under the same package, but it allows you to choose between the versions
oh like individual deb? not adding a 3rdparty repo?
Yeah. individual deb.
and it's still there after you "Reload" in synaptic?
also try search for the deb file on your system and removing it from the apt cache
I don't see apt-cache remove
I meant remove the deb package from the place on the filesystem where apt stores debs, not anything to do with the apt-cache command, looking for the path now
if the deb is in /var/cache/apt/archives remove it, then reload and see if it's still an options
It's clean. There are no debs there
then I have no idea, have to ask someone that has more knowledge of apt internals than me
any wise words for my issue?
